New Records: Mohamed Salah and Mohamed Elneny reached 100 caps for Egypt.
Key Match Events: Trezeguet scored the opening goal in the 4th minute after following up Salah's shot rebound.
Trezeguet scored a second goal in the 29th minute with a brilliant through pass from Rami Rabia.
Mohamed Salah scored in the 56th minute after a howler from the Botswanan keeper.
Mostafa Fathi scored the fourth goal for Egypt in the final seconds after a solo run and cross by Ibrahim Adel.
Pre-Game Insights: Egypt had to change their lineup heavily due to injuries and absences of key players like Omar Marmoush, Mostafa Mohamed, Ahmed Hegazi, Emam Ashour, and Mohamed Abdelmonem.
Osama Faisal and Khaled Sobhi were brought into the starting XI to fill in the gaps.
Post-Match Reflections: Egypt now tops the group with six points from two games, having scored seven goals and conceded none.
Egypt will continue their campaign in October 2024 with home and away games against Mauritania.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Botswana arrived just hours before the game, affecting their preparation.
The hosts had two chances to score in the second half but both efforts went wide.
